intro: Clavena baeocephala, commonly known as the white-headed clavena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Clavena baeocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its unique appearance.
